title: How to Make a File Read Only

steps.title: Right click on the file, you want to make it Read-only.
steps.content: Right click on the file, you want to make it Read-only .

steps.title: Click on the Properties tab from the context menu.
steps.content: Click on the Properties tab from the context menu.

steps.title: Click the Read-only check box belong to Attributes from on the General tab from the popped up Properties window.
steps.content: Click the Read-only check box belong to Attributes from on the General tab from the popped up Properties window.

steps.title: Click on Apply and then click on Okay.
steps.content: Click on Apply and then click on Okay .

steps.title: Open command prompt.
steps.content: Open command prompt . You can open it by clicking on Start->Run , then type cmd and hit Enter . You can also press Win Key+R .

steps.title: Write below codes and hit Enter to make your file Read-only.
steps.content: Write below codes and hit Enter to make your file Read-only . attrib +r "<file path="">"</file> Example: attrib +r "D:\wikiHow.txt"
